intro: Amethystanthus inflexus f. leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered amethystanthus, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers that are predominantly white in this particular form. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
